text: the apocalyptic scene in central Kiev
tonight a firewall of blazing tents and
smoking tires as protestors defiantly
love firecrackers and other missiles
confronting them a barrage of riot
police using water cannon trucks to push
their way forward this protester Ludmila
says she's not afraid I've been standing
here three months already she says I'm
here for Ukraine and for my family
earlier from inside the protest camp the
opposition leader Vitaly Klitchko urged
his supporters to stay put each of you
here should stay strong in spirit he
said because we're not going anywhere
a new and deadly phase in the fight for
Ukraine's future which had earlier
turned the center of the city into a
virtual war zone
protesters lobbying rocks and Molotov
cocktails the police retaliating with
rubber bullets stun grenades and
reportedly live ammunition the clashes
lasted for hours and led to deaths on
both sides as well as hundreds of people
injured here a wounded demonstrator
being helped by colleagues here a
policeman being hurried to safety the
worst day of violence since protests
erupted 12 weeks ago after President
Yanukovych rejected a far-reaching trade
deal with the EU in favour of closer
ties with Russia at the heart of the
protests in Ukraine are two opposing
visions of the country's future some
people especially older Russian speakers
in the industrial East want to stay
close to Russia the historic ally but
others younger and Western Ukrainians
want to break free of Russia's influence
and turn westwards towards Europe
divided loyalties which some fear could
end up splitting the country down the
middle yesterday it looked as though
tensions were subsiding there was signs
of a cleanup as protesters agreed to
vacate some government buildings in
return for an amnesty
against prosecution
it's still not clear who or what ignited
the trouble today possibly radical
protesters but some fear government
propagators providing the pretext for a
crackdown the American and European
governments say they're deeply worried
we are appalled by the violence that was
already taking place in downtown Kiev
and reports of armed riot police massing
on the edge of my don we continue to
condemn street violence and excessive
use of force by either side the force
will not resolve the crisis tonight
there are reports that the opposition
leader mr. Klitschko is meeting
President Yanukovych but it's still
unclear if negotiations can calm this
night of crisis Brigit candle BBC news
